com.ibm.team.repository.client

Interface IContentManagerInputStreamProvider


  • public interface IContentManagerInputStreamProvider
    An interface for a class that can continue opening an InputStream on the same resource for the benefit of the content manager. Note: all input streams must return the exact same bytes when read repeatedly.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FLAG_LOCAL_SCAN
      A flag that indicates the stream will be used for reading locally for the needs of the content manager before it uploads anything.
      static int FLAG_TRANSFER
      A flag that indicates the stream will be used for uploading the contents to the server.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.io.InputStream getInputStream(int flags)
      Returns a new InputStream that can be used to read the resource.
      java.io.InputStream wrapInputStream(java.io.InputStream in)
      The content manager will call this method to allow the receiver to wrap the final input stream used for uploading the content to the server.

    • Field Detail

      • FLAG_LOCAL_SCAN

        static final int FLAG_LOCAL_SCAN
        A flag that indicates the stream will be used for reading locally for the needs of the content manager before it uploads anything.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FLAG_TRANSFER

        static final int FLAG_TRANSFER
        A flag that indicates the stream will be used for uploading the contents to the server.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getInputStream

        java.io.InputStream getInputStream(int flags)
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          TeamRepositoryException
        Returns a new InputStream that can be used to read the resource. Multiple invocations of getInputStream() should return different InputStream instances which when read will produce the same data. The caller is responsible for closing the input stream.
        Parameters:
        flags - One of FLAG_LOCAL_SCAN or FLAG_TRANSFER to indicate the intended use of the returned stream
        Returns:
        The input stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        TeamRepositoryException

      • wrapInputStream

        java.io.InputStream wrapInputStream(java.io.InputStream in)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           TeamRepositoryException
        The content manager will call this method to allow the receiver to wrap the final input stream used for uploading the content to the server. The receiver may wrap the provided stream with cancellation or progress monitoring as needed and return the wrapped stream. Note: The receiver MUST NOT alter any bytes that are read from the stream and it MUST NOT read or close it.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream to wrap.
        Returns:
        the wrapped input stream, or the parameter in itself if the receiver does not wish to wrap the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        TeamRepositoryException
